inn1.comm: back of a length from over the stumps, Warner defends carefully from the crease.
didn't take him long to go full, but Warner was ready. He steers it off the front foot wide of mid-off, and Mahela moves quickly and dives to the right to save a couple of runs.
Wade opens the face and defends a full length ball towards point.
and the yorker, tails in late towards the leg stump as Wade tries to flick it away. He can't get bat on it, but they get a couple of leg byes away towards fine leg.
pitched up outside off stump, Wade moves nicely into a check drive into the covers.
yorker at 137 kph wide of off stump, Wade digs it out towards cover point.
back of a length from over the stumps, defended with an opened face towards point.
width, he gets away with it. Warner cuts it in front of square, but point jumps and saves.

goes straighter, gets the ball to angle across from wide of off stump. Warner defends towards mid off, uppish but ok. Remember Kula flying away for a caught and bowled the last time these sides played?
gets Warner's edge with a full ball angling across late. Warner pokes at it, and the ball runs away fine.
nice length, can't drive those. And it angles across once more. Wade defends it down the track.
an honest peach to end the over. Kula swerves it in the air, goes full and gets it to shape away late. Wade wades into the drive and misses, the ball did enough to beat the edge.
crisp from Warner. Malinga misses the line with his yorker, it goes down the leg side and Warner politely clips it off the toes for the first four of the day.
slower ball at 125 kph... Warner was setting himself up for the big bash through the off side, but he had to check himself. Still got a bottom edge as he looked to defend.
and again. 125 kph, the ball loops across and Warner looks to blaze away through the covers. He's undone by the lack of pace and loses his grip on the bat before the ball comes through.
three in three. Warner spots this early and looks to cut, but finds point.

full pace, full length and the inside edge. This is a good comeback from Malinga. Warner was clearly not ready for the change in pace and length, and looked to thrash through the off side without moving the feet. He gets a big inside edge onto his boot.
gets the single away at long last, waiting for the slower ball and slapping wide of point for one.
back of a length, Warner plays carefully to the off side.
hint of width, Warner wants to whack it through the off side but can't beat point.
ah, a gift from Kula. That was too straight, with fine leg inside the circle. Warner tucks it past that fielder and the ball bounds away.
tighter line, Warner nurdles to the leg side and Kula runs across to midwicket to field it. The field is set on the off side.
what happened there? Clocked at 106 kph, but Kula got the ball to jump and cut away from Wade who was squared up as he struggled to cover the line.
Wade's still on 0. Defends with an angled face towards point to end the over.

ohho, Malinga's lost it in a big way. He slings this one two yards down the leg side and it continues to go further down the leg side. He looks at his palm as soon as the ball goes out of it. Sweat? Sanga was in a different zip code.

he's bumped him now. Bouncer from Malinga, Warner took his eyes off it as he shaped to pull.. I think it came on slower than he thought, and he eventually fended it away instinctively. The ball spirals towards fine leg, but lands safe.
Wade's away, chopping a length ball towards point for one.
good work from Thisara at short cover, he moves fast to parry a push-drive into the covers, and denies Warner a single.

you can't bowl a better yorker than that. Unless you are Garner or Waqar. It was full, it curved in and kept coming at him as Warner jammed down on it. He half-stopped it with the toe of his bat but it seemed to be rolling towards the stumps, before spinning away late!
slower ball, back of a length, Warner defends to the off side.

Malinga's hoodwinked Warner in some style here. The pace has yo-yoed from the mid 140s to the low 120s, without any discernible change in action. Warner wasn't spotting them, and tried to take a start down the track this time for the chip. Malinga's offcutter came in slow motion, and Warner was through the shot when it pinged the bat. Too late to properly check the shot. Warner tries to, but ends up popping it straight to Maharoof at mid-on.
Kula continues to nip them across from leg stump. Wade defends to the off side.
full length, Wade is confidently behind the line as he defends down the track.
holds the length back again, Wade opens the face and defends to the off side.
hmm, interesting leave. 126 kph and the ball swings away from middle and leg, quite close to off stump. Wade shoulders arms.
pitched up on a driving length, Wade whips with a strong bottom hand, but finds mid-on.
another one nips away, testing the left hander's resilience. Wade opens the face and steers behind point.
length ball angled across the left hander from over the stumps. Wade leaves.
holds the length back, Wade is behind the line, and defends.
Wade gets away with a frustrated loft that just eludes Mahela running back from mid-off. Lack of pace from Maharoof too, Wade can't get any timing on his lofted drive, but gets away with it.
holds the length back, pushes Wade back and he defends to the off side.
good lengths these from Maharoof. 131 kph, doesn't offer anything to drive. Wade leaves.
Wade gets the single away, opening the face and steering behind point.
second gift of the morning from Kula. He'll be very cross. Another one outside leg, Wade nudges it with the angle through fine leg for four.
more line it, on the leg stump line, handcuffing Wade's scoring options. He defends down the track.
pitches this up, Wade moves nicely into the drive but picks out short cover.
And now 10. Back of a length on the stumps, Wade goes back and tucks it towards wide mid-on for one.
Kula bends the ball in from wide of off stump, Ponting defends down the track as it comes in.
pitched up and inviting the drive. Ponting leans out and punches to mid-off to end the over.
Wade didn't know much about that after shuffling across to a length ball. Works it off the inside edge behind square on the leg side for a single.
back of a length, Ponting moves confidently into the check drive.
ah, where's short leg when you need him? Ponting lunges and looks to defend as Maharoof swings it in, and it goes in the air to the leg side. They charge through for a single.
length ball wide of off stump, Wade defends watchfully to the off side.
on the pads, Wade works it with the angle towards square leg.
back of a length outside leg stump, Wade turns it away square for a single.
another run for Wade who opens the face and guides a length ball towards third man.
spongy bounce on a length ball wide of off stump. Ponting tries to carve it into the covers, but misses.
on a length outside off, Ponting is on the front foot as he defends.
full length ball, it swung in late as Ponting moved across for the flick. It went off a thick inner edge, uppishly, but into the gap at square leg.
short ball, Wade waits in the crease and carts it towards midwicket, but SL have a sweeper back there. Single taken.
needless cheekiness from Ponting, who tries to wait beside the line and steer a straight ball towards third man. Kula gets it to swing and beat him.
back of a length on middle and leg, Wade pushes it into the off side.
fuller length, Wade draws himself forward into the drive and gets a single to mid-off.
back of a length wide of off stump. Ponting lets it go to the keeper.

and he's got him! Ponting's poor form extends. He's yet to get to 10 in this series. What a lovely slower ball that. Maharoof sucked Ponting into a drive down the ground with a 117 kph slower ball, and he played it right back at him. Maharoof put his hands up and snaffled it, this is such a fine comeback for him.
wide of off stump, Forrest defends to the off side.
Wade opens the face and negotiates with another perfect delivery from Kula.
gets him driving with a full length ball into the off side.

Australia in a hole now. Wade's gone after a mix-up of epic proportions. Thisara Perera has done a Jonty Rhodes in the short cover region. Full length ball outside off, Wade pushed it into the covers, a good five yards to Thisara's right, but he moved like a panther and dived full length to gather it in his palm. Forrest saw Thisara moving and started reluctantly for the single, but chose to go full tilt after Thisara stopped it. Wade had already backed out, meaning both of them were stranded mid-pitch when Thisara had lobbed it to the bowler. Gone by a mile.
short of a length outside off, Forrest defends to the off side.
Forrest defends a length ball carefully down the track.
full length ball to Hussey, who defends off the front foot.
full length, a touch wide of off stump, Mike Hussey lets it go again.
Mike opens the face as he leans out and defends.
A Hussey special, that. Full length and angling across, Hussey beavers across and drives cleanly through the covers.
holds the length back, Hussey watches it closely and lets it go.
back of a length to end the over, it is defended towards mid-off.
uppish but into the gap. Mathews sends down a slower ball to start off, Forrest plays a very Watson-esque comprehensive cover drive, but he plays it in the air, over wide mid-off for four.
short ball, Forrest adjusts and cuts, again uppish but safe, for a single.
back of a length, Hussey stays on the crease and defends to the off side.
swings towards Hussey's pads and he tucks it behind square for a single.
another tight single.. Forrest goes back in the crease and works to the leg side. Hussey responds quickly and beats Chandimal's pick up and flick, which missed the stumps in any case.
Hussey lets a length ball outside off go through to the keeper.
Maharoof continues to plug away, on a length wide of off stump, and Forrest leaves.
holds the length back, Forrest moves across and defends to the off side.
on the pads, Forrest tries to tuck it square but can't get the single away.
short of a length, Forrest goes back and steers to the off side.
full length on off stump, Forrest defends it down the track.
superb lengths. Short of driving length outside off, Forrest can't do much except defend it to the off side.

Sanga goes up straight away for a caught behind, as he always does. Mathews joins in late, the umpire doesn't react. No edge on that. Hussey tried to steer and missed. And he looked back immediately, which once again debunks that stupid tell-tale sign myth. And Sanga, that was naughty!
Hussey opens the face and steers to the off side for a single.
Forrest gets width and cracks the cut through the cover and point gap. Top timing, the ball screeches away. Watson is looking in great touch, time to remove the mask now.
full length ball on middle and off, defends down the track.
full length outside off, Forrest leans out to meet it with a solid forward push.
lets the last ball go wide of off stump, through to Sanga.
full length on Hussey's pads, turned away watchfully to the leg side.
pad first? Maharoof appeals for an lbw after drawing Hussey forward on a push to the covers. Bat and pad were close together, but it might have been missing off in any case.
slower ball at 116 kph, wobbles away outside off stump and Hussey leaves. Unlike Malinga, this man uses the slower ball sparingly.
back of a length on middle stump, Hussey turns it square carefully.
short of a length on off stump, defended down the track.
on the pads, Hussey tucks towards midwicket for a single. Drinks in Sydney.
full length from Angelo, lack of pace as he angles across, gets Hussey to inner edge to the leg side.
Hussey goes back in the crease and tucks to the leg side.
Maharoof hares in from mid-off to cut away any thoughts of a single as Hussey pushes off the front foot.
short now, Hussey chops it square and Dilshan springs up at point to stop it.

smoking guns! Hussey has nailed that. Length ball from Mathews on a good inviting line on middle and leg. Hussey stays back and swings it merrily over midwicket, jabbed with clinical bottom hand muscle. The ball takes off.

and he's gone next ball. Mathews is beside himself with glee. He keeps this on a length just outside off, and Hussey tries to be cheeky as he plays a cut close to the body. The ball kisses the outside edge and heads straight into Sanga's gloves.
full and fast straight away, Forrest manages to squeeze it away.
much shorter length, the ball jumps up from a length and Forrest fends airily behind point. Second time he's done that today, but there's no one to catch.
back of a length outside off, David Hussey defends to the off side.
fuller length, draws David forward and he defends into the covers.
short of a length wide of off stump, David watches it swing away and leaves.
short of a length from Malinga to end the over, Forrest lets it go to the keeper.
back of a length from Mathews, defended watchfully from the crease.
attacks the pads with a full length, Forrest works it to the leg side.
stays back in the crease and defends with the angle towards wide mid-on.
Mathews gets the ball to nip in, but that doesn't prevent Forrest from steering behind point for a single.
pitched up to David, who times a check drive into the covers really well. The ball slows down in the outfield, but David sprints back for three.
Mathews strays onto the pads, Forrest gladly glances him with the angle for four through fine leg. Quite a few fours today have come off balls slipping down the leg side.
banged away. Whoa, these Hussey's have really good bottom hands. Short ball from Maharoof, landed back of a length outside off. David stays back and slaps it disdainfully through midwicket for four.
width again, David cuts it hard behind point, but Dilshan dives away to parry it and save the boundary.

Things getting worse for Australia. At this rate, this game will be over before the rain comes. Maharoof keeps it on a nagging line just outside off, and Forrest flirts with it perilously. The ball kisses the outside edge and settles in the hands of the widish fly slip, who couldn't have been positioned more accurately.
full length ball to welcome Dan Christian, who defends off the front foot.
slower ball, short of a length wide of off stump and Christian lets it go.
leans out to a fuller length ball and defends to the covers again.

Malinga's dropped him! Sri Lanka's first blemish in the field. Short and wide from Thisara, David got under it and slashed it in the air towards third man. The ball didn't go too high, but it was going straight to Malinga, who couldn't hold on as it sailed into his lap. Hussey had given up, he looked gutted as it went towards Malinga. And then ...
and over-pitched now, Christian was waiting for the drive and played it quite beautifully through mid-off.
gets the single this time with an airy flick through midwicket.
full length wide of off stump, driven solidly off the front foot.
back of a length outside off stump, David lets it go.
lets another one go outside off as Thisara probes away outside off.
length ball wide of off stump, Hussey defends to the off side.
keeps it on a perfect length outside off stump, and Christian defends.

Nearly another return catch for Maharoof, but it has gone down. Pitched up to Christian, who booms the straight drive in the air straight back. The ball was travelling and Maharoof did quite well to adjust and get his right hand out to the ball. But it didn't stick.
Christain plays it down watchfully this time, to the off side.
slow legcutter at 111 kph, Christian waits and tucks behind square on the leg side for one.
Hussey looks to cut a wide ball and misses it. Through to Sanga safely.
short of a length from Thisara, Christian covers the line and defends down the track.
back of a length again, defended from the crease into the off side.

Another one bites the dust. Thisara has pinned Christian in front with an indipper. He was looking to get across to middle stump and work it to leg, but the ball burst through to hit the pad. Was it missing leg stump? I want to see a replay of that. Right, Hawk-Eye shows it would have missed leg stump.
full length from Perera, McKay pushes it wide of mid-off off the front foot.
wide of off stump, McKay shoulders arms.
back of a length outside off, Mckay gets behind the line and defends.
slings the first ball down the leg side, and it is called wide.
tossed up on off stump and straightening. Defended off the front foot.
on DJ's pads, he nudges with the angle through square leg for one.
curled in from wide of the crease, and it is pushed off the front foot into the mid-off area.
angled into middle and off line, and it is pushed off the front foot.
tossed up on the stumps, defended again
armer, half an appeal for lbw as McKay leans out to defend. Bat or pad first? Seemed like the former.
ah, vintage David Hussey. His walking cover drive, where the footwork includes two steps down the pitch for the single, much like Ajay Jadeja used to do it. What deliciously good timing, too.
back of a length wide of off stump, this time DJ lets it go.
similar ball wide of off stump, David lets it go once more.
over-pitched, DJ tries another booming drive but this one is too full for him.
length ball, shaping in slightly as DJ looks to get forward. He pushes it to mid-off, still no single.
another one of those Jadeja drives from DJ, there's a sweeper back this time and he gets the single.
full length, DJ goes back in the crease and defends down the track.
fuller, curling in from wide of the crease, driven with the turn into the off side.
slow and loopy, DJ goes back and defends to the off side.
short ball, DJ slices it straight to Chandimal at point.
straight and full length, defended off the front foot.
good start from Herath, a maiden. He gets DJ's leading edge with curl and loop, but it goes safely to the off side.
back of a length outside off, McKay stays in the crease and defends to the off side.
looks to cut a short ball, but he's beaten for pace though it wasn't a particularly fast ball.
quick and bends the back on this one. McKay adjusts well to open the face and guide it to third man for one.

too much width, DJ carves it away behind point to Malinga at third man... And he fumbles again! The ball might be greasy, but no excuse for that one. A second run conceded. He did get a bad bounce after going down and setting up the long barrier, though.
straighter from Thisara, DJ covers the line well and defends.
different fielder at third man, this time it is Maharoof. He collects DJ's glide cleanly but it is placed well enough for two.
another dot from Herath. McKay defends off the front foot into the off side.
inside edge saves McKay as he looks to flick and plays the full ball onto the boot.
slow and tossed up, McKay pushes it to mid off.
at long last, Herath concedes some runs. The ball slides towards the leg side and McKay tucks it square for two.

on your bike, young man. Classic left-arm deception from Herath, whose tossed up the left-arm spinners all over. He slyly slides in the arm ball, faster and straight from a slightly shorter length this time. McKay didn't pick it as he thrust the pad forward and played outside the line. The ball thuds into the foam in line with off, and it seems to be crashing into middle.
tossed up on off stump, Lee leans out to defend.
full length ball to DJ, who punches fluently into the covers for a couple.
short ball, crashed away. DJ is playing a menacing little hand here. There was width outside off for DJ to set himself up and crack it through backward point, and he did it without a fuss.
better line, cuts the room and DJ defends it back down the track.
DJ stays back and quietly drops the ball towards point for a single. Two balls for Clint to negotiate.
Lee gets a leading edge now, closing the face a touch early on a full ball on the pads. It rolls out towards point.
short of a length outside off, defended to the off side.
armer again, DJ goes back and hacks into the off side for a single. Malinga sends a woeful return to the keeper.
tossed up to Lee who defends watchfully.
that drifted in, Lee was advancing, and managed to adjust and play it back to the bowler.
tries the quicker one, Lee defends off the front foot, and gets bat on it.
angled in towards middle and leg, Lee keeps it out.
another dot ball, Lee presses forward and pushes straight to cover.

Mahela shies at the stumps, but this time he misses. He was magnificent against India the other day. Slower ball on middle and off, DJ works it wide of mid-on and sets off. Mahela sprints in and flicks it at the stumps, but misses. DJ is in, in any case.

Sri Lanka are unstoppable on the field! Thisara Perera pulls off another special run out, this time all by himself. Over-pitched outside off, Lee drives wide of mid-off and goes for the single. Thisara cuts the angle quickly as he approaches the ball and hurls it down at the stumps at the bowler's end. Dead-eye. Lee is out by a yard. Gone for a nine-ball blob.
low full toss to DJ, who inner-edges the flick onto the pad.
pitched up at 142 kph, DJ drives well but finds Angelo Mathews at extra cover.
short of a length, slower ball outside off. DJ watches it closely and steers to third man for a single.
slower ball to Starc, he pushes uncertainly and plays it uppishly towards point.
back of a length outside off stump, DJ pushes him into the covers for a single.
drifts one across the left hander from round the stumps, and it slides past the nervous outside edge.

he bowls a bit like the other Mitch, and his batting isn't much different either. Starc goes down and heaves with the turn through wide mid-off, and Maharoof makes a hash of things on the deep to let the ball go through his legs to the boundary.
another slider across Starc, who stays back and pushes to the off side for one.
DJ tries to push a single into the off side, but finds short extra cover.
DJ keeps strike with a nurdled single through square leg.
there, DJ refuses the single off the first ball of Malinga's over. Full ball outside off, driven to the sweeper on the off side. No run taken.

well run! DJ charges through for the second after working Malinga with soft hands through midwicket. Herath took a while getting rid of the ball after running in for the deep and that was enough for Starc to make it.
dropped by Mathews at short extra cover. it went dead straight at him, but he is standing close in, and that was hit quite hard. Full ball, punched off the middle. Straight in, straight out.
another full ball outside off, DJ hits it to Mathews again, this time along the ground.
slower ball, back of a length and glided off the face of the bat towards third man.
slower ball, if you can call 130 kph slow. Starc spots it and works it wide of mid-on, and is resourceful enough to come back for two, handing the strike over to DJ in the process.
starts with a slower ball, of the full offspinning variety. DJ spots it and defends back to the bowler.
slow legcutter now, DJ drops it to the off side for a single.
short of a length outside off stump. Starc is looking the part, he waits and dabs it to third man for a single.
another legcutter, but it is too slow to bother DJ who tucks it square for one. Starc, for some reason seemed to think there was a second, but he changed his mind in the nick of time.
Thisara beats Starc outside off with a slower ball, he tries to guide him through the off side but the ball snakes past.
Dilshan's not letting anything go past him at point. Wow fielding, this. Short ball outside off, Starc chops it powerfully, but Dilshan flies to his left to stop it.

The yorkers haven't been working today, another low full toss from Malinga, and DJ bunts it straight between the bowler and mid-on. Mahela makes a big effort, but he wasn't straight enough to stop that.
over-pitches it this time. DJ opens up the off side and drives powerfully through the covers for two more.
bumper now, DJ's milking Malinga with authority. How costly are those two drops going to prove? He clambers on top of the bounce here and slaps it down through midwicket. Superb batting.
slower ball wide of off stump, you almost saw it coming. DJ waits and steers to third man yet again for a single.
he gets the yorker going now, but Starc has no problem jamming down on it.
back of a length on the middle and leg line, Starc easily drives to the leg side.
slow legcutter, driven with the deviation towards mid-off, and Mahela is on the prowl once again. He dives to save the boundary.
back of a length outside off stump, Starc defends to the off side.
tries a cheeky steer to third man now and is beaten for pace as Kula angles one across.

well, Sri Lanka's fielding has been a bit Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde today. Chandimal over-runs a regulation save at deep backward point now, slipping and sliding on the greasy outfield. Width outside off, Starc hacks it efficiently behind point and has four.
on the pads now, Starc tucks it through square leg for one more.
DJ goes back to a very straight ball and dabs it to the right of Sanga for a single. He will keep strike.
short of a length outside off, Malinga wants to give DJ a single, but DJ refuses it. He cracks it to deep cover, and turns down the run.
very slow slower ball, comes through at 100 kph and DJ is beaten as he tries to jab at it. That hit the seam and bounced extra.
another slower ball, DJ cuts it efficiently into the covers and charges back for a fine fifty. This is turning into a breakthrough series for the younger Hussey. Really showing his worth here.
offcutter on middle and off, at long last DJ relinquishes strike. He works this down to long-on for one.
length ball, sent down wide of off stump. Starc doesn't bite, he lets it go.
The Malinga meltdown continues. He thumps down a bouncer that takes off well over the batsman and Sanga. Five wides. Horrible bowling. The rain seems to have put the radar out of operation.
slower ball to end the over, Starc defends it down the track.

Kula's done this a few times today. Another one slips down the leg side, and DJ happily works it down to fine leg for four. The protection was inside the circle, once it went to his right it was always four.
pitched up on the stumps, DJ muscles it down to long-on for a single. They think of the second, but the return is good and quick.
length ball to Starc, he tries to slap it to the leg side and gets it to bounce over Kula, but there's protection at mid-on.
another dot, Starc is messing up the Powerplay over. He can't lay bat on a full ball angled across outside off.
drives a full ball powerfully down the ground, but long-off is back. Only a single.
superb comeback from Kula after the freebie off the first ball. Slow legcutter, DJ quietly pushes to the off side and gets a single to retain strike.
I can't believe he got away with that. Slings this one wide of off stump, and there's no way DJ could have reached it. Wide not called.

at long last, Thisara has got DJ caught deep on the off side. He should have had him with his first ball today. Another full ball angling across wide of off stump, Hussey had to reach out and try to carve it in the air. He picked out the sweeper on the off side, who took the catch well. DJ has played his part here, reviving Australia from the doldrums. They have a chance now.
short ball, Starc pulls it straight to midwicket. Another dot ball.
goes full and angles in towards the pads. Starc lashes it to long-on for a single.
back of a length outside off stump, Doherty taps to the off side for a single.
full toss wide of off stump, Starc slaps it down the ground for a single to long-off.
pitched well up on the stumps, Starc gets an inside edge through square leg for a single.
gets a really good yorker in. Doherty did well to ensure there was no damage, jamming down on it and playing it down the track.
back of a length slower ball at 124 kph, Doherty misses the cut.
yorker but wide of off stump now, the X-man manages to steer it through point for a single.

Kulasekara hits the stumps now down, but has Starc made it? Nope. Another full ball, Starc works it to mid-on and sets off. Kulasekara bounds in and fires in the throw to the bowler's end. Starc is out by half a foot. The CB series should be renamed the Run-out series.

inn2.comm: and he starts with a wide. The ball lands wide of off stump and swings away. There is some juice on offer here for the seamers.
bounce for Lee, gets the ball to jump up at Mahela from a length. He fends it without much conviction to the leg side.
Mahela is away, opens the face and steers Lee down to third man for a single.
back of a length outside off stump, Dilshan watches it closely and leaves.
short of a length, Dilshan is tucked up by the kick on that delivery and defends down the track.

whoa, Lee's working up some pace here! He's hit Dilshan on the chest with a back of length ball that took off and burst through the defences. The glove took some of the impact, else Dilshan would have been in strife.
146 kph to end the over, back of a length and steep bounce outside off. Dilshan leaves. This won't be an easy chase.
gets it to straighten towards Mahela's pads from over the stumps. Mahela nudges it with the angle towards square leg for a single.
beats him with a peach. Angles across, hits the seam and then nips further away leaving Dilshan squared up and flummoxed in its wake.
over-pitched on the pads and swinging in. Dilshan can't get it away cleanly as he looks to clip but SL get the single.
back of a length, straightening into the pads, Mahela nudges it to fine leg for one.
135 kph on a length ball, Dilshan pushes into the covers for one. Christian slips and slides as he tries to field..
slings this down the leg side for a big wide.
oh, absolutely glorious from Mahela! Full-pitched ball outside off, and he plays the perfect off drive. The ball screams off the middle of the face through to the boundary.
Dilshan beaten again by a lethal Lee delivery that jumps away from a length. Close to the edge that.

in the air, just short of fine leg. Dilshan went for the pull, Lee hurried through him at pace and it ended up as a swirling top edge. McKay ran in quick and made good ground, but the ball bounced just out of his reach as he went down.
better from Dilshan, gets behind the line and defends to the off side.
slower ball not, it cuts into Dilshan who can't get bat on it. Rapped on the thigh now, he is taking the odd body blow.
back of a length, Dilshan tries to heave through the off side, and mistimes a single into the covers.
superb length, just outside off stump and Mahela lets it go to the keeper.
back of a length on off stump, Dilshan defends down the track as it straightens.

Dilshan has biceps bigger than Popeye. Boy, he's climbed onto that and smashed it. Short of a length ball, straightens into the slot and Dilshan short-arm jabs it with disdain all the way over square leg. That didn't go too high, but it went very far.
back of a length outside off stump, he pushes into the off side and takes another single.
pitched up teasingly wide of off stump, Mahela is drawn into the drive and it skims off the outer half of the blade through point for a couple.
Mahela is already putting on a mini-exhibition. He presses forward and caresses a length ball on the up, perfect bisection of the gap between cover and wide mid-off for three more.
Dilshan plays the same shot with double the effort and half the finesse. And none of the placement. Straight to wide mid-off for a risky single.
he's clobbered that as well. He saw the short ball early, and was already setting himself up for a swipe over the leg side. He sends it dribbling over wide mid-on for four more.
thump. He can now blow the smoke off the barrel and slide it back into the holster. Stays back and swings a length ball merrily through square leg for four more.

Lee keeps dropping short, Dilshan keeps pulling. Fine leg moves in front of square now, and Dilshan skips inside the line to effortlessly exploit the new gap with a masterly slap from outside off stump. At this rate, this ball will lose shape very fast.
just for variety, he takes a single now. Full ball on the pads, punched through mid-on for a single.
back of a length outside off stump, Mahela stays back and glides it behind point for one.

the Dilscoop now. Needless too. Dilshan tries to lap Lee from wide of off stump over fine leg. I think. He could have played it over third man too, or straight into his own mouth. Play and a miss means the ball goes straight to Wade.
short of a length outside off stump, quietly dropped to point.
beaten outside off, didn't see that coming did we... Mahela looks to dab from outside off to third man, but the ball slips past the outside edge.
and beaten again. Needless risk from Mahela, who again tries a cheeky dab towards third man and misses.
hmm, Mahela tries to blaze one through the covers. He backs away and looks to go big, and misses again. Take the single and give it to Dilly, mate.
lets a loopy short of length ball outside off go through to the keeper.
lets another back of a length ball outside off go through to the keeper. A maiden from McKay.
Dilshan tries to bash Lee over the off side, but the ball is through him in a trice.
short ball wide of off stump, Dilshan thinks of pulling but backs out of it.
slow bumper outside off, Dilshan wanted to send it to Melbourne, but adjusted and slapped it square as it came through slowly.
full-pitched on off stump, Mahela's movements are a touch slow and he inside-edges onto his pad.
visceral from Dilshan. Half a step towards the pitch of the ball and a sumptuous on-the-up thump to a length ball outside off, the ball disappears behind point for four more.
tries to do it again, doesn't time it too well now.
Mahela gets the single away early, stays back and chops a length ball into the off side for one.
length ball angles in towards the pads, and Dilshan tucks it square to the leg side for one.

close to slip, but not close enough. Mahela tries to steer from wide of off stump, well away from his body but he was confident of eluding slip. He managed to do it by a couple of metres, and gets a single.
nothing shot from Dilshan. Stays rooted on leg stump and finishes outside off stump. McKay beats him for pace.
short of a length ball outside off stump, Dilshan steers through backward point for a couple more.
ahem, Ponting fumbles at point. Until today, he's been quite good there. Dilshan guides a length ball straight through Ponting for a single.
no shot offered, no runs for Sri Lanka, which is a fair call. The ball was swinging down the leg side, Dilshan didn't really play a shot as it swung onto the pads and hurtled to fine leg.

full toss on the stumps, Dilshan whips it to the leg side and takes a single. The throw comes in and hits Dilshan's bat as he runs in, and ricochets towards the cover boundary. Dilshan refuses to run the extras.
beats Mahela outside off with a seamer that jumps across. The left-armer's angle, always troubles a right hand batsman.
Mahela gets the single now, stays back and drops the ball to the off side for one. Dilshan is through immediately.
onto Dilshan's pads, he works it behind square leg for a couple more.
tries to heave on the up through the covers, but can't time the shot well enough.
back of a length outside off, Dilshan cuts through backward point for two more.
on the pads now from over the stumps, Dilshan tucks it square for a single.
nicely done. Mahela gets a fraction of width outside off, and he stands tall to guide it through backward point for a couple. Ominously well timed.
over-pitched on the stumps, Mahela milks another two with a neat little whip off the toes.
slower ball outside off, Mahela chops it straight to point.
another slower ball, Mahela delicately defends to the leg side and they take another single.
Dilshan keeps stealing singles surreptitiously like a B-grade Bollywood music composer. Back of a length outside off, Mahela drops it to point and Dilshan flies through for the run.
short ball, Dilshan waits for it to come on and pulls to the deep for one more.
over-pitched wide of off stump, Mahela drives past point for a single.
short ball outside off, Dilshan hacks it powerfully through square but there is protection.
on the pads now, Mahela nurdles to the leg side for a single.
pitched up outside off, Dilshan drives a touch airily, but gets it away off a thick inside edge for a single.
short of a length outside the off stump, Dilshan picks up another single through backward point.
similar line, Mahela looks to steer now but can't get it past point.

brainfade from Mahela, but he survives. What's going on here? Dilshan is looking the saner batsman of these two! Mahela jumps out and tries to hoick him over the off side, he's not near the pitch of the ball and loses the grip as he miscues. It lands just short of mid off.

Australia will breathe easy, they have a wicket finally. Length ball wide of off stump, the line most likely to trouble a batsman. Dilshan throws his bat at it and gets a thick edge straight to the slip fielder.
good length ball angling across off stump, Sanga lets it go.
pitched up on off stump, Sanga drives fluently to mid-off.
short of a length outside off stump, he's still generating some pace. Mahela stands tall and guides it through backward point for a single.
hmm, close call there. Mahela sprints in as Warner picks up and under-arms in one go from backward point. Mahela was in, and Warner missed the stumps.
too short that bouncer. Mahela easily ducks under it.
slower ball outside off, Mahela works it to the leg side for a single.
Sanga glorious. Over-pitched by Lee on the stumps, Sanga shows it the full face and smokes it down the ground. This time Lee doesn't put his foot in the way.
back of a length, Sanga defends from behind the line to the leg side.
length ball outside off, Sanga inside-edges a push onto his boot and it dribbles into the off side.
Mahela opens up his wrists and eases the ball through backward point for two more.
fuller length, Mahela meets it with a forward press, under the eye, under control.
back of a length outside off stump, Mahela drops it to the off side, but they can't get a single.
keeps it tight on middle and off, Mahela defends to the leg side.
sumptuous cover drive to a full length ball wide of off stump. This is looking easy.
McKay tries to bowl Sanga behind the legs, but the ball is called wide as Sanga skips across.
Sanga tries to guide a short of length ball towards third man, but McKay does him for pace.

that kind of day for SL. Mahela has found the middle of the gap between Wade and the wide fly slip. Pitched up and seaming away, Mahela is drawn into driving away from the body and it takes the edge. Wade should have gone for it, but though slip would have it covered.
on the pads, worked to the leg side for one.
Sanga moves to 9998. Skips out of the crease and carves a full and wide ball over cover-point for four.
lets a length ball wide of off stump go through to the keeper.
pushes a length ball into the off side, they think of a single but choose to stay put.
short of a length and angled across, Sanga lets it go to the keeper.
pitched up outside off, Mahela check-drives with a full face towards mid-off.
beaten by a nifty little legcutter. Mahela feels for it as it zips past the outside edge ...
Mahela skips out and sees the length being shortened. He adjusts well to chop it behind point for a couple.
length ball outside off, Mahela pushes it into the off side.
angled into the pads, defended to the leg side watchfully.
full and wide of off stump, Mahela throws his bat at it and squeezes a single to third man. He's making Sanga wait for the five-figures here.
angled into the pads, tucked with the angle towards square leg for a single.
you may have 9998 runs, but you could still be beaten by a peach. Christian gets it to cut in fast and furious, opening up Sanga as he tries to play to the off side.
pitched up on the stumps, defended down the track.
Sanga skips out and tucks to the leg side. 9999.
short of a length outside off, Mahela hacks behind square for a single.
Christian's turn to keep Sanga waiting. Wide down the leg side now.
still waiting.. Full length ball, carefully defended to mid-on.
curled in from wide of off stump, Mahela defends as it comes in.
aha, Mahela's manufactured a boundary. He walks across the stumps, goes down on a knee and lap-sweeps over the head of short fine leg for four.
fuller length, cuts the angle and forces Mahela to defend down the track.
pitched up wide of off stump, Mahela defends to the off side for a single.

10,000 runs to the legend. The crowd goes up in applause. I don't know if he was play-acting, but Sanga initially looked surprised. He then smiles and trots to his team-mate and hugs him. Welcome to the 10,000 club, says Mahela.
tossed up outside off, driven through mid-off for one.
Mahela keeps playing the cover drive the way it should be played. Pitched up wide of off stump, and it is driven with care through the off side for one.
full length wide of off stump, Mahela manages to get it behind point for a single.

good play from Christian. Sanga was out of the crease, and played it back to Christian who picked up and threw down the stumps. Sanga was in, and then tried to steal the overthrow, but Christian was already after the ricochet.
short of a length outside off, dabbed through backward point for one.
slips down the leg side, and it goes off Mahela's pads for a leg bye. Wilko on air believes the dead-ball call earlier was a wrong one. He's got to be kidding, surely.
short of a length outside off, Sanga punches into the covers.
Mahela looks to sweep and edges onto the pad. The umpire misses it and signals leg byes.
Sanga has lashed him away. Short ball, swept with power through square leg.
Sanga's tying this up quite nicely. He dances out of the crease and bangs Doherty with the turn miles over midwicket for six. Huge.
angled in towards the pads, Sanga nudges to the leg side for one.
short of a length outside off, Mahela chops it straight to point.
tossed up outside off, Mahela defends to the off side.
full and wide, angling across, and Sanga throws his bat at it with glee. Thick outside edge, flies high over the slip fielder and goes for four. It is all going Sri Lanka's way today.
back of a length on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on.
keeps it on the spot outside off, defended to the point area. No single to be had.
flayed through the covers now. Nice inviting lengths, and Sanga wades into them. There's protection in the deep though, so he only gets a couple.
short ball, hustles through Sanga, who looks to pull but is beaten for pace.
gets it away off the middle this time, but there is protection at deep midwicket.
Sanga's breezy little hand has come to an end. Full length ball angling into the pads, he tries to hoist over the leg side and gets a big leading edge that goes straight up. Easy catch at mid-on.
Mahela has 50 now. Welcome relief, it's been ages since he reached a 50 in any format. Short of a length, dropped towards covers and the single is taken.
short of a length on off stump, defended down the track.
pitched up outside off, Chandimal pushes to the point area for a quick single. He's away too.
full ball on off stump, Mahela tries to whip drive through mid-on, but can't find the gap.
high full toss outside off stump, Mahela droves into the covers for another single.
good length ball outside off, Mahela defends to the off side.

absolutely glorious. Nothing's better to watch than a batsman jumping out to a fast bowler and thumping him inside out over the covers. Mahela's made Christian look like a spinner there, superb footwork and even better timing.
angled in towards the pads, tucked to the leg side quietly for a single.
Chandimal defends a length ball into the off side.
short of a length, Chandimal still can't get the single away as he drops it to the off side.
thumping stroke from Chandimal, shuffling inside the line and pulling with the angle as Christain drops it short. He goes aerial on purpose and picks up four authoritative runs behind square.
short of a length, nipping in off the seam, nudged with the angle to the leg side for one.
back of a length, Chandimal jumps behind the line and defends.
full length on the stumps, Chandimal whips through square leg for a single.
slow bouncer, Mahela can't get bat on it as he looks to dab it to third man.

Mahela's class is oozing all over the SCG now. Get the covers out. Short ball outside off, he leans back languidly and steers with surgical precision through backward point. I can't explain why the ball went at the speed at which it did. It scorches the outfield on the way to the fence.
over-pitched on the pads, Mahela flicks straight to midwicket.
The win comes courtesy a leg bye. Christian angles into the pads, Chandimal can't get bat on the flick, but the ball goes off the pads to square leg, and Mahela scampers through.
